intro: Drepananthus olivaceus, commonly known as the oliveleaf drepananthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Drepananthus olivaceus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
